means: 腿过长的，有优美的腿的
（特指小孩、小马等）腿细长的，细腿的

sentence.Network_en: He was six feet four, all lanky and leggy.
sentence.Network_cn: 他身高6英尺4英寸，瘦高个儿，大长腿。

sentence.Network_en: "The British tabloids called me leggy and stunning," she recalls.
sentence.Network_cn: “当时的英国小报都说我‘双腿修长’、‘艳惊四座’，”她回忆道。

sentence.Network_en: The leggy beauty was none other than our own Naomi Campbell.
sentence.Network_cn: 这位长腿美女不是别人，正是咱们的娜奥米·坎贝尔。

entry.def: If you describe someone, usually a woman, as leggy, you mean that they have very long legs and usually that you find this attractive.

example.ex: The leggy beauty was none other than our own Naomi Campbell.
example.tran: 这位长腿美女不是别人，正是咱们的娜奥米·坎贝尔。
